result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A. Robl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

No contact with Richard Christensen and/or No contact with Richard Sodke. 
No contact with BMO Harris Bank. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Any contact with Melanie Firkus needs to be pre-approved by the agent prior to contact, then no violent or abusive contact with Melanie Firkus. 
Complete and comply with counseling related to anger management and domestic abuse as well as AODA Aftercare treatment. 
Complete a parenting class. 
Sign releases of information for offender's assessments, medications/pharmacies/treatment.
Comply with other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and DOC. 
Submit DNA sample if not done so.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing held on June 24, 2016
Sent Final Reminder Notice
Counts 2, 3, & 4 - Non-probation
Count 1 - Prison

Defendant Zachary A. Robl in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Defendant Zachary A. Robl in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent is also present.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-120, 15CM-425, 16CF-96, 15CF-395 and 15CT-162.

9:08 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Defendant previously entered pleas, Court ordered a PSI. One was prepared and copies were forwarded to counsel.
State has complied with victim notification statutes. Ms. Firkus has a statement to present. State has corrections from a factual standpoing in the PSI, states this for the record. State moves to remove the domestic abuse repeater enhancer in 16CF-96 in Ct 2 and Ct 3. Maximum penalties are addressed. Atty Halverson concurs. Court questions Defendant regarding pleas in these two counts. Defendant understands, is willing to go forward.

Court addresses the recommendations in the PSI report on Page 32. Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding some component of extended supervision.

Atty Halverson has no corrections from a factual standpoint.
Atty Halverson states Defendant's mother may make a statement. Court clarifies only victims can make a statement but she may testify.  Atty Halverson replies.  

9:18 AM Dawn Crawford is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Halverson.
9:24 AM Cross-examination by Atty Molepske.

9:26 AM M. Firkus has a statement, Atty Molepske reads the statement into the record.

9:29 AM State makes sentencing recommendations. 

9:50 AM Atty Halverson makes sentencing recommendations, 130 days credit on 16CF-96. 15CF-395 has 105 days credit as well.

State addresses bond.

10:05 AM Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

10:06 AM Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court believes PSI is thorough and complete.

15CF-395:
Ct 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence of 3 yrs 6 mo
Initial Confinement of 1 yr 6 mo
Extended Supervision of 2 yrs
0 Days Credit
Conditions:
Any contact with Melanie Firkus needs to be pre-approved by agent prior to contact, then no violent or abusive contact with Melanie Firkus
No Contact with Richard Christensen and/or No Contact with Richard Sodke
No Contact with BMO Harris Bank, do not be on premises of any BMO Harris Bank
Complete and comply with counseling related to anger management and domestic abuse as well as AODA aftercare treatment
Complete a parenting class 
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Sign releases of information for offender's assessments, medications/pharmacies/treatment
Comply with other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and DOC
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Pay court costs out of prison account at rate of 25%, balance to be paid on extended supervision
Pay v/w surcharge
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample if not done so

Jail sentence for 9 Months concurrent to Ct 1
Pay court costs

Pay DNA surcharge

Pay DNA surcharge

130 days credit

Pay court costs

Pay DNA surcharge

Initial Confinement of 1 yr 6 mo
Extended Supervision of 1 yr 6 mo
Conditions:

Pay court costs

Pay DNA surcharge

Pay court costs

Pay DNA surcharge

Pay DNA surcharge

Pay DNA surcharge

Jail sentence for 9 Months, concurrent to 15CF-395
105 Days Credit

Pay DNA surcharge

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

8:20 a.m. Defendant Zachary A. Robl in court in custody with attorney Acalia N Halverson. DA Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CM120, 16CF96, 15CF395, 15CM425, & 15CT162. 
15CF395: State requests Count 1 be reopened and the Defendant will plea to it.
16CF96 is scheduled for plea today. The other cases had pleas taken at the prior hearing in January.

Plea Hearing for 16CF96 2, 3, 4, 5, 10 & 11 & 15CF395 Reopen Ct 1:  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF96 Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 10 & 11: No Contests
15CF395 Reopened Ct 1: No Contest
15CF395 Ct 2, 3, & 4: No Contest affirmed as entered in January.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Victim was notified and not present today.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty:
 16CF96 Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 10 & 11 and domestic abuse assessments and repeaters 
15CF395 Reopened Ct 1 and Cts 2, 3, & 4 and domestic abuse assessment as outlined in the informations:.  
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 
16CF96 Counts 1, 7, 8, & 9 are dismissed and read in and 16CF96 count 6 is dismissed outright.

DA Molepske requests PSI report.

BY THE COURT:****PSI report ordered.
To be completed and forwarded to counsels by 06-21-16.
Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on May 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on May 3, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference at 02-29-2016 01:30 pm
Sentencing hearing at 02-16-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Zachary A. Robl in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Louis Molepske Jr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-395, 15CM-120, 15CM-475, 15CT-162 and 15CM-425.

3:39 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea hearing today.

15CM-120: Defendant will plead to Count 1
15CT-162: Defendant will plead to charge 
15CF-395: State will dismissed and read in Count 1. Defendant will plead to Count 2 and 3 and 4
15CM-425: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in. 
15CM-475: Will be dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes

Victim notice has been made and Ms. Firkus is in the courtroom.
Atty Halverson concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-120: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CT-162: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-395: Count 4: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CM-425: Count 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Halverson for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CM-120: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CT-162: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-395: Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 3: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CF-395: Count 4: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-425: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
15CM-425: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CM-475: Dismissed and Read In

Due to time constraints, these cases will be adjourned for sentencing at another date.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing at 01-26-2016 03:15 pm

Pre-trial conference at 12-07-2015 08:30 am

3:28 p.m. Defendant Zachary A. Robl in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant Zachary A. Robl in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case 15CF395 is heard for a Preliminary Hearing and 15CM425 is following as a status.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.
15CT162, 15CM425, 15CM120 to track with this file and be set for pretrials.

Atty Halverson request bond modification. (Bond already says it) if safety plan is filed, then no abusive contact. same conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Halverson
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by Melanie Firkus - wants contact but the Court ordered no contact.
Preliminary hearing at 11-02-2015 03:00 pm

This bond covers both 15CF395 & 15CM425:

Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered to both counts in 15CM425 and 15CF395 Counts 2, 3 & 4.
